intro: Remijia grazielae, commonly known as the Graceful Remijia, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, fuzzy layer, aiding in moisture retention. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
